result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander C. D. Otis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alexander C. D. Otis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alexander C. D. Otis was found guilty of False Swearing-Government Setting, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: St Croix County Case No. 14CF292

superMiscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court Office by payment plan of $25.00 per month commencing after all other fines are paid to St Croix County. May be taken out of prison wages.

$400.00 payable to Amery Pawn, $1,590.00 payable to Valley Pawn plus 10% surcharge of $199.00 totaling $2,189.00 to be paid to the Clerk of Court Office by payment plan of $25.00 per month commencing when St Croix County fines/costs have been paid. To be paid out of prison wages.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.
If not a U.S. Citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. No voting. No holding elective office.
